org.youscope.common.job

Class JobAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • org.youscope.common.job.JobAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote, Component, Job
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EditableJobContainerAdapter

    public abstract class JobAdapter
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements Job
    Convenient adapter class to implement a job. Basic required functionality (evaluation counting, job listener notifications, ...) of a job is already implemented.
    Author:
    Moritz Lang
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public JobAdapter(PositionInformation positionInformation)
           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • assertRunning

        protected void assertRunning()
                      throws MeasurementRunningException
        Convenient method to throw an exception if a parameter of a job should be changed, but the job is currently executed. Should be called at the beginning of every function which is manipulating the parameters of the job (i.e. all "set" methods).
        Throws:
        JobRunningException
        MeasurementRunningException

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Returns true if the measurement the job belongs to is currently executed.
        Returns:
        True if the job is currently executed.

      • executeJob

        public void executeJob(ExecutionInformation executionInformation,
                       Microscope microscope,
                       MeasurementContext measurementContext)
                throws JobException,
                       java.lang.InterruptedException,
                       java.rmi.RemoteException
        The standard implementation of this function automatically takes care for evaluation counting and the notification of listeners. Do not overwrite this function, but runJob() instead (which is called by this implementation)
        Specified by:
        executeJob in interface Job
        Parameters:
        executionInformation - Information about how many times the job has been executed, and if it is executed in a loop.
        microscope - Interface to control and get information of the microscope.
        measurementContext - the context of the measurement, allowing to transfer data between measurement components and similar.
        Throws:
        JobException
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • runJob

        public abstract void runJob(ExecutionInformation executionInformation,
                            Microscope microscope,
                            MeasurementContext measurementContext)
                     throws JobException,
                            java.lang.InterruptedException,
                            java.rmi.RemoteException
        Convenient function which gets called by executeJob(). Does not have to take care for execution counting and notification of job listeners. Overwrite this method instead of executeJob.
        Parameters:
        executionInformation - Information about the number of times, and the loops, in which this job is executed.
        microscope - The microscope on which this job should be executed.
        measurementContext - the context of the measurement, allowing to transfer data between measurement components and similar.
        Throws:
        JobException
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        java.rmi.RemoteException

        Returns the component's position information, e.g. in which well, tile, or z-stack location it is.

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String jobName)
             throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: Component
        Sets the name of the component meant for human interpretation. Usually, the default name of a component contains already sufficient information. However, for some measurement types it can be of advantage to rename certain components which have a specific meaning for the respective measurement.
        Specified by:
        setName in interface Component
        Parameters:
        jobName - Name/short description of the component.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getDefaultName

        public abstract java.lang.String getDefaultName()
                                         throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Should return a default name for the job type which gets returned by getJobName() if no job name was set explicitly by setJobName.
        Returns:
        Default job name. Should be short, but however informative.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getUUID

        public java.util.UUID getUUID()
                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: Component
        Returns a unique ID of the component. No two components have the same unique ID, even if they are created using the same configuration. See UUID.equals(Object) and UUID.randomUUID().
        Specified by:
        getUUID in interface Component
        Returns:
        Unique ID of the component.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
